column5: I see on the Control Board website that the water level is a little down and they continue to lower how much water they are letting out. What's it really looking like? How much is it down compared to last year? Is it super dry job there around Kenora area? 10 days to go!!!

Water level is down about a foot from this time last year.The LWCB actually has an exiting flow of 375 mÂ³/s... which is one of the slowest outflows I've seen. They are trying to bring the level up slowly, or at least prevent it from going down. We could use some rain though.
I agree, down about a foot to 15 inches near Kenora. Not really enough to affect navigation or fishing.
